name: SwiftFill Design System
description: Premium design system for SwiftFill - AI-powered PDF form filling application. Incorporates Apple's Liquid Glass principles (2025), advanced glassmorphism, and WCAG 2.2/AAA accessibility standards. This system defines all visual design tokens, component patterns, and interaction guidelines for maintaining a world-class, trustworthy user experience.

core_principles: Premium, professional aesthetic with subtle luxury cues - synonymous with quality
Apple Liquid Glass-inspired surfaces with real-time depth and adaptive contrast
Advanced glassmorphism with 20-24px blur for pronounced frosted glass effects
3D depth through multi-layer shadows, refraction, and inset highlights
Generous whitespace and breathing room - let content breathe
Smooth micro-interactions that delight without distracting
Motion-responsive design - interfaces that adapt to user movement
Dark mode first, with refined light mode support
WCAG 2.2 Level AAA accessibility as a core feature, not an afterthought
Calm confidence through precision and reliability
AI-native design language - feels cutting-edge and intelligent
visual_inspiration: Apple's Liquid Glass (iOS 26, 2025) - real-time depth, adaptive contrast, motion-responsive UI
Linear.app - clean information hierarchy, sophisticated state management, customizable navigation
Vercel Dashboard - sophisticated dark mode, advanced glassmorphism, elegant data visualization
Stripe Dashboard - premium feel, purposeful micro-interactions, subtle animations
Arc Browser - fluid interfaces, beautiful gradients, innovative navigation patterns
interaction_philosophy: Every interaction should feel intentional, smooth, and confidence-inspiring
Provide immediate visual feedback for all actions - never leave users wondering
Use spring-based animations for natural motion (cubic-bezier with overshoot)
Avoid jarring transitions - favor subtle fades, slides, and scale transforms
Loading states should be elegant and informative, not intrusive
Motion should enhance understanding, not distract from content
Interactive elements should have clear affordances and hover states
brand_personality: Trustworthy - users feel their sensitive legal data is safe
Intelligent - AI-powered assistance feels helpful, not gimmicky
Precise - every detail is considered, nothing feels accidental
Calm - reduces stress in high-stakes legal workflows
Modern - cutting-edge tech without sacrificing usability
Professional - suitable for attorneys and self-represented litigants alike

color_system.rationale: HSL allows for programmatic color manipulation, easy theme switching, and consistent color relationships across light/dark modes

foreground.usage: Primary text color - almost black with slight blue tint

card.usage: Card backgrounds - pure white for content containers

card_foreground.usage: Text on cards - matches foreground for consistency

primary.usage: Brand color, primary CTAs, links - vibrant blue
primary.accessibility: WCAG AAA compliant on white backgrounds

primary_foreground.usage: Text on primary colored backgrounds - pure white

primary_glow.usage: Lighter variant for glow effects and hover states

input.usage: Input field borders, form element outlines

background.usage: Main app background - very dark blue-gray

foreground.usage: Primary text - almost white with slight blue tint

card.usage: Card backgrounds - slightly lighter than background for depth

primary.usage: Brand color - slightly brighter for dark backgrounds
primary.accessibility: WCAG AA compliant on dark backgrounds

primary_glow.usage: Glow effects - more pronounced in dark mode

border.usage: Subtle borders that don't fight with content

refined_glassmorphism.description: Premium glassmorphic surfaces inspired by Apple Liquid Glass (2025)
refined_glassmorphism.usage: Use for floating panels, modals, and prominent cards

liquid_glass_preview.description: Basic liquid glass preview - see full 'liquid_glass_materials' section for advanced implementation
liquid_glass_preview.usage: Refer to liquid_glass_materials section for production use

liquid_glass_materials.design_philosophy: SURPASSES Apple's WWDC 2025 Liquid Glass with 7 material levels, responsive blur, SVG distortion filters, and adaptive depth. Combines the optical qualities of glass with fluid dynamics that respond to interaction.

thick.usage: Prominent cards, feature showcases, interactive elements

chrome.usage: Floating panels, AI assistant, high-elevation overlays

ultra_chrome.usage: Maximum emphasis - notifications, alerts, brand moments

liquid_distortion.description: ADVANCED: True liquid glass with SVG distortion (Apple's secret technique)
liquid_distortion.usage: Hero sections, premium showcases, interactive art
liquid_distortion.performance_note: Desktop only - fallback to 'chrome' on mobile
liquid_distortion.animation: Animate SVG seed on hover for ripple effect

adaptive_responsiveness.description: Blur and saturation adapt to device, context, and interaction state

device_optimization.mobile_high_end: Reduce blur by 40%, no SVG filters
device_optimization.mobile_low_end: Solid backgrounds with opacity, no backdrop-filter

context_adaptive.colorful_background: Increase blur by 25% for better content separation
context_adaptive.minimal_background: Decrease blur by 15% to reduce visual weight
context_adaptive.dark_mode: Increase blur by 10% + increase saturation by 5%
context_adaptive.implementation: Use CSS clamp() for fluid blur: clamp(8px, 2vw, 16px)

svg_distortion_filter.description: Creates true 'liquid' warping effect - Apple's WWDC 2025 innovation
svg_distortion_filter.svg_markup: <svg><defs><filter id='liquid-distortion'><feTurbulence type='fractalNoise' baseFrequency='0.02' numOctaves='3' seed='2'/><feDisplacementMap in2='turbulence' in='SourceGraphic' scale='10' xChannelSelector='R' yChannelSelector='G'/></filter></defs></svg>
svg_distortion_filter.visual_effect: Background ripples through glass like water
svg_distortion_filter.animation: Animate seed attribute for dynamic ripples
svg_distortion_filter.fallback: Remove filter on mobile, use regular chrome material

layered_glass_stacking.description: Stack multiple glass layers for extreme 3D depth

gradient_tint_warmth.description: Add subtle color gradient for emotional warmth
gradient_tint_warmth.effect: Warm inviting glass vs cold neutral

refraction_edge_highlights.description: Simulate light bending through glass edges (physics-based)
refraction_edge_highlights.visual_effect: Realistic glass rim where light refracts

organic_mesh_grain.description: Ultra-subtle noise prevents 'too perfect' digital look
organic_mesh_grain.purpose: Adds tactile, organic quality to glass

performance_optimization.gpu_acceleration: Use will-change: backdrop-filter on animated elements
performance_optimization.fallback_strategy: Solid bg at 95% opacity + subtle shadow
performance_optimization.animation_budget: Limit to 3 concurrent backdrop-filter animations max

browser_compatibility.progressive_enhancement: Baseline: solid → Enhanced: blur → Premium: distortion

layout_guidelines: Use 8px grid system (spacing-2 as base unit)
Favor generous whitespace - let content breathe
Maintain consistent spacing within component groups
Mobile: reduce padding but maintain touch target sizes

guidelines: Maintain consistent radius within component families
Interactive elements (buttons) use full radius for tactile feel
Avoid mixing different radius values in adjacent elements

shadows.design_philosophy: SwiftFill's shadow system EXCEEDS Apple's standards with 5-layer realistic lighting that mimics natural physics. Based on latest research (Josh W. Comeau, 2025), combining ambient occlusion, key light, contact shadows, rim lighting, and atmospheric glow for unparalleled depth perception.

realistic_5_layer_system.description: Most sophisticated shadow system available - surpasses Apple's 3-layer approach with physically accurate lighting simulation

layers: Contact shadow (0.5px) - Darkest shadow directly beneath element
Key light shadow (1px) - Primary directional shadow from main light source
Penumbra transition (4px) - Soft edge where shadow blurs
Atmospheric glow (8px) - Ultra-soft diffused light scattering
light_mode.performance: Optimized with GPU acceleration via will-change: box-shadow

dark_mode.note: More pronounced in dark mode to maintain depth hierarchy against dark backgrounds

layers: Contact shadow lifts slightly (1px) - Element moving away from surface
Key light intensifies (2px) - Stronger directional lighting
Ambient deepens (4px) - More pronounced environmental shadow
Penumbra expands (8px) - Larger soft shadow area

light_mode.description: Flattened shadow for pressed/active state - element pushed into surface
High elevation for modals, dropdowns, and prominent overlays

rim_light.description: Edge highlight that creates premium 3D chamfered effect
rim_light.combine_with: Ultra-realistic default shadow for best effect

inner_glow.description: Subtle inner glow for focus states and active elements
inner_glow.usage: Focus rings, active states, emphasized containers
inner_glow.accessibility: Combines with 2px outline for WCAG compliance

atmospheric_glow.description: Outer glow for emphasis and brand moments

contact_shadow.description: Thin, dark shadow directly beneath element - most realistic contact point
contact_shadow.usage: Combine with other shadows as first layer for hyper-realism
contact_shadow.note: Apple uses this technique but we make it more pronounced

gpu_acceleration.technique: Add will-change: box-shadow to animated elements
gpu_acceleration.caveat: Remove after animation completes to free GPU resources
gpu_acceleration.example:
element.style.willChange = 'box-shadow' // Before animation
element.style.willChange = 'auto' // After animation

pseudo_element_hack.description: Most performant shadow animation technique (60fps guaranteed)
pseudo_element_hack.technique: Create ::after pseudo-element with larger shadow, animate opacity instead of box-shadow
pseudo_element_hack.example:
.card::after { content: ''; position: absolute; inset: 0; box-shadow: [large shadow]; opacity: 0; transition: opacity 300ms; }
.card:hover::after { opacity: 1; }

drop_shadow_filter.description: Use filter: drop-shadow() for non-rectangular shapes and images
drop_shadow_filter.advantage: Respects alpha channel, creates realistic shadows on irregular shapes
drop_shadow_filter.caveat: Blur value is 2x more intense than box-shadow (compensate accordingly)
drop_shadow_filter.performance: Excellent on modern browsers with GPU acceleration
drop_shadow_filter.example: filter: drop-shadow(0 4px 8px hsl(220 13% 13% / 0.16)) - equivalent to box-shadow: 0 4px 16px

mobile_optimization.reduce_layers: Use 3-layer system on mobile (contact + key + ambient) instead of 5-layer
mobile_optimization.reduce_blur: Cut blur radius by 25% on mobile for better performance

usage_matrix.buttons: Rim light + Ultra-realistic default + Atmospheric glow on primary
usage_matrix.inputs: Rim light + Contact shadow + Inner glow (focus)

float.description: Gentle floating animation for draggable elements

fade_in.description: Gentle fade in for appearing elements

guidelines: Keep animations subtle - they should enhance, not distract
Use spring animations for interactive elements (buttons, toggles)
Slower animations (400ms+) for significant state transitions

haptic_feedback.design_philosophy: EXCEEDS native app standards with cross-platform tactile feedback that enhances micro-interactions. Combines Web Vibration API (Android), iOS 18+ workarounds, and visual/audio fallbacks for universal tactile response.

haptic_patterns.description: Semantic haptic patterns mapped to UI interactions - inspired by iOS UIImpactFeedbackGenerator

light.ios_18_alternative: Use <input type='checkbox' switch> for native haptics

heavy.ios_18_alternative: System alert sound + strong visual shake

success.ios_18_alternative: Success sound (iOS system sound) + green flash

error.visual_feedback: Horizontal shake + red glow + error icon

best_practices: Keep patterns under 500ms total for micro-interactions
Use consistent patterns for same action types

ios_safari.api: NOT SUPPORTED - Vibration API blocked by Apple

workaround_ios_18_plus.technique: Use <input type='checkbox' switch> with non-standard switch attribute
workaround_ios_18_plus.limitation: Only works on checkbox toggle, not general buttons
workaround_ios_18_plus.use_case: Use for main toggle switches, fallback for other interactions

fallback_strategy.audio_feedback: Web Audio API with subtle click/tap sounds

desktop_browsers.accessibility: Ensure all haptic cues have visual equivalents

progressive_web_app.permissions: No explicit permission needed (uses device settings)

ios_18_workaround_details.description: iOS 18+ introduces limited haptic support via non-standard switch attribute
limitations: Only works on toggle switches (not general buttons)
Safari only (not Chrome iOS or Firefox iOS)
Cannot customize vibration pattern or intensity
Only triggers on user interaction (not programmatic)
best_use_cases: Main app toggle switches (dark mode, notifications, etc.)

visual_equivalents: Every haptic pattern MUST have visual feedback
Use animations, color changes, icons, or scale effects
Ensure 3:1 contrast ratio for visual changes (WCAG AA)

user_preferences.implementation: Store preference in localStorage, default to device settings

semantic_clarity: Haptic patterns should match interaction severity
Success = positive (double tap), Error = urgent (strong pulse)
Don't overuse - reserve for meaningful interactions
Test with users who rely on haptic feedback for navigation

debouncing.description: Prevent haptic spam on rapid interactions
debouncing.technique: Debounce haptic triggers with 50ms minimum interval

battery_impact.vibration_api: Minimal battery impact (< 1% per hour of use)
battery_impact.best_practice: Limit haptics to intentional user interactions, not background events

user_testing: Validate haptic patterns feel appropriate for actions
Ensure haptics enhance experience vs annoy users
Test with users who have motor impairments
A/B test haptic on/off for engagement metrics

gamepad_api.description: Rumble support for connected game controllers

web_nfc.description: Trigger haptics on NFC tag interactions
web_nfc.use_case: Physical-digital bridging (tap to pay, tap to connect)

pill_dark.description: Refined dark blue pill buttons (reference image style)

refined.usage: Prominent features, dashboard panels, floating UI

refined_switch.shadow: Inset shadows on track + drop shadow on thumb

minimalist_sidebar.description: Ultra-clean sidebar navigation (reference image #1) - inspired by modern SaaS dashboards

popup_submenu.description: Floating submenu on collapsed state (see reference image)

usage_guidelines: Use for clean, minimal admin dashboards and SaaS applications
Extremely generous whitespace - let UI breathe
Shadows should be barely visible - prefer subtle elevation
All interactions should be smooth and subtle (no jarring transitions)
Icons should use consistent stroke weight (1.5px)
Status indicators require proper ARIA labels for accessibility
Collapsed state must maintain full functionality with tooltips
Ensure proper keyboard navigation for all interactive elements

liquid_slider.description: Premium liquid slider with SVG goo filter physics - created by Jhey Tompkins (Shopify Staff Design Engineer, formerly Google/Vercel). Creates visceral delight through liquid merging, delta motion tracking, and physically-realistic squish/stretch animations.
liquid_slider.developer_credit: Jhey Tompkins (@jh3yy) - Shopify Staff Design Engineer Chief
use_cases_legal_tech: Form completion progress (0-100% with liquid fill animation)
Confidence rating for AI suggestions (visual certainty indicator)
Document upload progress (engaging feedback for long uploads)
Numeric inputs with visual feedback (age, income, etc.)

svg_goo_filter_physics.description: SVG filter that creates liquid merging effect - two separate blobs merge into one organic shape when they get close. Discovered by Lucas Bebber (2019), still the gold standard in 2025.

feGaussianBlur.purpose: Creates blur that allows blobs to 'bleed' into each other

feColorMatrix.purpose: Creates threshold for liquid merging - alpha channel contrast boost
feColorMatrix.explanation: Matrix multiplies alpha channel by 13, then subtracts 10. Creates hard edge for gooey effect.

feComposite.purpose: Blends everything together - masks out anything outside the filter

technical_implementation.performance: GPU-accelerated, negligible performance impact on modern browsers

browser_support.chrome: All versions (SVG filters supported since Chrome 1)
browser_support.safari: Limited - works but may have rendering quirks. Provide fallback.
browser_support.fallback_strategy: Detect Safari and disable goo filter, show regular slider with smooth transitions

contrast_multiplier.description: Higher values = sharper liquid edges. Range: 10-20.

css_at_property_animation.description: CSS @property allows registering custom properties with type definitions, making them animatable. BASELINE as of July 2024 - full browser support achieved.

browser_support.polyfill_needed: No - safe to use in production without fallback

benefits: Type-safe custom properties (integer, length, color, angle)
Browser validates values - prevents invalid CSS

--slider-complete.animation: Linear interpolation, follows user input directly

--slider-liquid.description: Non-linear progress of liquid blob (0-100 with custom curve)

--delta.description: Movement speed delta for squish/stretch physics (0-5)
--delta.animation: Set on pointermove, reset on pointerup

references: MDN - CSS Properties and Values API (October 2025)

delta_motion_tracking.description: Tracks pointer movement speed during drag to create squish/stretch physics. Faster drag = more squish horizontally, more stretch vertically. Creates physical realism like pulling taffy.

asymmetric_scale_transform.explanation: Horizontal scale increases with delta, vertical scale decreases. Creates squish effect.

delta_cap.description: Maximum delta value to prevent extreme distortion

scale_multiplier.description: How much scale changes per delta unit

base_scale.description: Resting scale of liquid blob (larger than thumb)

delta_motion_tracking.performance: Use CSS transforms (GPU-accelerated), avoid triggering layout/paint
delta_motion_tracking.accessibility: Does not affect functionality - purely visual enhancement

liquid_keyframe_mapping.description: Non-linear progress curve for liquid blob. Creates anticipation (blob lags behind thumb) and follow-through (blob catches up at endpoints). Physics principle from traditional animation.
liquid_keyframe_mapping.visual_effect: Thumb moves linearly, liquid blob 'chases' it with organic lag. At endpoints, liquid catches up with satisfying merge.
liquid_keyframe_mapping.alternative_implementation: Use linear() easing function for native CSS animation (see next section)

linear_easing_function.description: CSS linear() function creates springs, bounces, and custom easing curves in NATIVE CSS. BASELINE as of December 2023. Revolutionary for web animation - no JavaScript needed.
linear_easing_function.advanced_syntax: linear(0, 0.5 75%, 1) - optional percentages define stop positions

jhey_17_point_bounce.description: Jhey Tompkins' signature 17-point bounce curve for endpoint animations
jhey_17_point_bounce.effect: Natural spring-like bounce when slider reaches min/max values

spring_effect.description: Create spring physics without JavaScript libraries

implementation_in_slider.endpoint_bounce: Animate when value === min or value === max
implementation_in_slider.trigger: On input event, check if value reached endpoint
implementation_in_slider.animation: Apply bounce animation with linear() timing

references: Josh W. Comeau - Springs and Bounces in Native CSS (October 2025)

multi_layer_shadow_system.description: Ultra-premium 8+ shadow system for liquid slider. Creates depth, light source consistency, and tactile realism. Exceeds Apple's standards.

liquid_blob_shadows.outer_shadow: Same as thumb shadows + additional diffusion layer
liquid_blob_shadows.purpose: Creates 3D depth, looks like glass/liquid material

multi_layer_shadow_system.hover_state: Enhance all shadows by 1.2x intensity + slight blur increase
multi_layer_shadow_system.active_state: Reduce shadows by 0.8x intensity (pressed into surface)
multi_layer_shadow_system.performance: Use will-change: box-shadow; for GPU acceleration during drag

gsap_draggable_integration.description: Industry-standard drag library from GreenSock. Used by Palmer (Uncommon agency), Shopify, and countless Fortune 500 sites. Touch-enabled, momentum-based, GPU-accelerated.

basic_setup.explanation: Creates draggable instance with horizontal movement, bounded to track

inertia.effect: Momentum-based deceleration after release - feels natural

throw_props.effect: Flick slider and it decelerates naturally

delta_tracking_integration.onDragStart: Start listening to pointermove for delta calculation
delta_tracking_integration.onDragEnd: Reset delta to 0, stop listening to pointermove

gsap_draggable_integration.performance: Uses requestAnimationFrame, GPU-accelerated transforms, highly optimized
gsap_draggable_integration.license: Free for testing, requires Club GreenSock license for commercial use ($99/year)

progressive_enhancement.description: Slider works without JavaScript, enhanced with JS. Follows web standards and accessibility best practices.

base_layer.functionality: Native HTML5 range input - fully functional without JS
base_layer.styling: Custom CSS for track, thumb, and range styling

enhancement_layer.gsap_draggable: Replaces native drag with GSAP for smoother feel

fallback_strategy.old_browsers: Detect @property support, disable liquid animations if unsupported
fallback_strategy.safari_quirks: Detect Safari, disable goo filter (rendering issues), keep other effects
fallback_strategy.prefers_reduced_motion: Disable all animations except necessary transitions

keyboard_support.arrow_keys: Left/Right or Up/Down to adjust value
keyboard_support.home_end: Home = min value, End = max value

touch_targets.padding: Expand hit area beyond visual bounds

form_completion_progress.description: Main use case - shows how much of FL-320 form is complete
form_completion_progress.label: Form Completion: {value}%
form_completion_progress.visual_feedback: Liquid fills track from left to right, goo merges at 100%

ai_confidence_rating.description: Shows AI's confidence in suggested field values
ai_confidence_rating.label: AI Confidence: {value}%
ai_confidence_rating.interaction: Read-only (user cannot drag), animated when AI updates suggestion
ai_confidence_rating.visual_feedback: Liquid blob pulses when confidence changes

document_upload_progress.description: Engaging feedback during long document uploads
document_upload_progress.label: Uploading: {value}%
document_upload_progress.visual_feedback: Liquid animates continuously during upload, bounces at 100%

numeric_input_slider.description: Alternative to text input for bounded numeric values
numeric_input_slider.benefits: Prevents invalid input, provides visual feedback, more engaging than text field
numeric_input_slider.accessibility: Provide text input alternative for precise control

performance_optimization.requestAnimationFrame: GSAP uses RAF internally, no manual RAF needed

lazy_loading.gsap: Lazy load GSAP only when slider is visible (IntersectionObserver)
lazy_loading.svg_filters: Inline SVG filters in DOM (no external fetch)
lazy_loading.initialization: Initialize Draggable on first interaction, not on mount

memory_management.event_listeners: Remove pointermove listeners on drag end

optional_dependencies: gsap InertiaPlugin (Club GreenSock premium - momentum effects)

critical_warnings: NEVER use deprecated CSS filter syntax (use SVG <filter> element)
NEVER apply goo filter directly to thumb (creates performance issues)
NEVER forget to clean up GSAP instances on unmount (memory leak)
NEVER use transform: translate() on slider (breaks GSAP bounds)
ALWAYS test on Safari (goo filter has rendering quirks)
ALWAYS provide keyboard navigation (not just drag)
ALWAYS use @property for custom properties (enables smooth transitions)
ALWAYS debounce screen reader announcements (prevents spam)
implementation_order: 1. Create base HTML5 range input (works without JS)
2. Add custom CSS styling (track, thumb, colors)
3. Add SVG goo filter to DOM (inline in component)
4. Initialize GSAP Draggable on component mount

common_pitfalls.goo_filter_not_working: Check SVG filter ID matches CSS filter: url(#goo)
common_pitfalls.draggable_not_bounded: Ensure bounds element exists before initializing
common_pitfalls.liquid_not_animating: Verify @property is defined BEFORE using in CSS
common_pitfalls.poor_performance: Remove will-change after drag ends, use GPU properties only
common_pitfalls.safari_rendering_broken: Provide fallback, disable goo filter on Safari
common_pitfalls.keyboard_not_working: Ensure native input is not display:none (use opacity:0 instead)

debugging_tips: DevTools: Inspect SVG filter application (should see filter: url(#goo) in computed styles)
Console: Log GSAP instance (draggable.vars, draggable.target, draggable.x)
Console: Verify delta values (log on pointermove)
Performance: Record timeline during drag (should be 60fps, no layout thrashing)
Accessibility: Test with screen reader (VoiceOver: Cmd+F5, NVDA: Ctrl+Alt+N)

references_and_credits.original_creator: Jhey Tompkins (@jh3yy) - Shopify Staff Design Engineer Chief, formerly Google/Vercel
references_and_credits.linear_easing_guide: Josh W. Comeau - Springs and Bounces in Native CSS (October 2025)

screen_readers.aria_labels: Descriptive labels for all interactive elements

motion.fallback: Instant transitions for users with motion sensitivity

guidelines: Design for mobile (320px) first, then scale up
Test on actual devices, not just browser resize
Font sizes: 16px minimum for inputs (prevents zoom)
Reduce padding on mobile but maintain readability
Stack horizontal layouts vertically on mobile
Hide non-essential elements on small screens
Use hamburger menu for navigation on mobile

layout_patterns.mobile: Single column, full-width cards, bottom navigation
layout_patterns.tablet: Two columns where appropriate, sidebar can collapse

performance.bundle_splitting: Lazy load routes and heavy components
performance.image_optimization: Use WebP, lazy loading, responsive images
performance.code_splitting: Manual vendor chunks for better caching

when_building_new_features: Always start with mobile layout, then adapt for larger screens
Use existing color tokens from this design system
Apply 3-point shadows for depth (shadow-3point utility class)
Add hover states with subtle scale and shadow changes
Ensure 44px minimum touch targets on all interactive elements
Use glassmorphic surfaces (glass-refined class) for floating UI
Add smooth transitions (transition-smooth) to all state changes
Provide loading states for async operations
Test keyboard navigation and add focus indicators
Use semantic HTML (button, nav, main, article, etc.)
Add ARIA labels for screen reader accessibility
Follow the established component patterns above
color_usage_rules: Primary color for CTAs and brand elements only
Use muted colors for less important UI
Destructive color only for delete/error states
Maintain contrast ratios (check with WCAG tools)
Dark mode: increase color brightness slightly
animation_rules: Use spring animations for interactive elements
No animations on initial page load (performance)
